doc:
Véra Korène https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/V%C3%A9ra_Kor%C3%A8ne 0 Véra Korène (June 6, 1901 – November 19, 1996), was a Russian-born French actress and singer. Born Rébecca Véra Korestzky in Russia of Jewish heritage, she fled the Revolution and settled in Paris, France. Using the Francized name Korène, she began her career in the theatre but also appeared in a number of films during the 1930s. A mainstay of the Parisian stage, in the 1950s she organized her own theatre production company, putting on performances at the Comédie Française. In 1956 she was named director of the Théâtre de la Renaissance, a position she held until 1978. Véra Korène died in 1996 in Louveciennes in a senior citizen's home and was interred in the Cimetière de Pantin in the Parisian suburb of Pantin. Partial Filmography:
The Faceless Voice (1933) Belle de nuit (1933) Second Bureau (1935) Sept hommes, une femme (1936) L'Argent (1936) Le batelier de la Volga (1936) Au service du tsar (1936) Deuxième Bureau (Second Bureau) (1936) Tamara la complaisante (1937) Double crime sur la ligne Maginot (1937) La danseuse rouge, 1937 (The Red Dancer) (1937) Café de Paris (1938) La Brigade sauvage (1939) Véra_Korène ( June_6_,_1901 – November_19_,_1996 ) , was a_Russian-born_French_actress_and_singer . Born Rébecca_Véra_Korestzky in Russia of Jewish_heritage , she fled the_Revolution and settled in Paris , France . Using the_Francized_name_Korène , she began her_career in the_theatre but also appeared in a_number of films during the_1930s . A_mainstay of the_Parisian_stage , in the_1950s she organized her_own_theatre_production_company , putting on_performances at the_Comédie_Française . In 1956 she was_named director of the_Théâtre_de_la_Renaissance , a_position she held until 1978 . Véra_Korène died in 1996 in Louveciennes in a_senior_citizen 's_home and was_interred in the_Cimetière de Pantin in the_Parisian_suburb of Pantin .
